verses.verse: And he said <WG3004> also <WG2532> to his disciples, <WG3101> There was a certain <WG5100> rich <WG4145> man, <WG444> which <WG3739> had <WG2192> a steward; <WG3623> and the same <WG3778> was accused <WG1225> to him that he had wasted <WG1287> his goods. <WG5224>

And he called <WG5455> him, and said <WG2036> to him, How <WG5101> is it that I hear <WG191> this <WG5124> of you? give <WG591> an account <WG3056> of your stewardship; <WG3622> for you may <WG1410> be no <WG3756> longer <WG2089> steward. <WG3621>

Then <WG1161> the steward <WG3622> said <WG2036> within <WG1722> himself, <WG1438> What <WG5101> shall I do? <WG4160> for my lord <WG2962> takes <WG851> away <WG851> from me the stewardship: <WG3622> I cannot <WG3756> <WG2480> dig; <WG4626> to beg <WG1871> I am ashamed. <WG153>
I am resolved <WG1097> what <WG5101> to do, <WG4160> that, when <WG3752> I am put <WG3179> out of the stewardship, <WG3622> they may receive <WG1209> me into <WG1519> their houses. <WG3624>

So <WG2532> he called <WG4341> every <WG1538> one <WG1520> of his lord's <WG2962> debtors <WG5533> to him, and said <WG3004> to the first, <WG4413> How <WG4214> much <WG4214> owe <WG3784> you to my lord? <WG2962>

And he said, <WG2036> An hundred <WG1540> measures <WG943> of oil. <WG1637> And he said <WG2036> to him, Take <WG1209> your bill, <WG1121> and sit <WG2523> down <WG2523> quickly, <WG5030> and write <WG1125> fifty. <WG4004>

Then <WG1899> said <WG2036> he to another, <WG2087> And how <WG4214> much <WG4214> owe <WG3784> you? And he said, <WG2036> An hundred <WG1540> measures <WG2884> of wheat. <WG4621> And he said <WG3004> to him, Take <WG1209> your bill, <WG1121> and write <WG1125> fourscore. <WG3589>

And the lord <WG2962> commended <WG1867> the unjust <WG93> steward, <WG3622> because <WG3754> he had done <WG4160> wisely: <WG5430> for the children <WG5207> of this <WG5127> world <WG165> are in their generation <WG1074> wiser <WG5429> than <WG5228> the children <WG5207> of light. <WG5457>

And I say <WG3004> to you, Make <WG4160> to yourselves <WG1438> friends <WG5384> of the mammon <WG3126> of unrighteousness; <WG93> that, when <WG3752> you fail, <WG1587> they may receive <WG1209> you into <WG1519> everlasting <WG166> habitations. <WG4633>

He that is faithful <WG4103> in that which is least <WG1646> is faithful <WG4103> also <WG2532> in much: <WG4183> and he that is unjust <WG94> in the least <WG1646> is unjust <WG94> also <WG2532> in much. <WG4183>

If <WG1487> therefore <WG3767> you have not been <WG1096> faithful <WG4103> in the unrighteous <WG94> mammon, <WG3126> who <WG5101> will commit <WG4100> to your <WG5213> trust <WG4100> the true <WG228> riches?
And if <WG1487> you have not been <WG1096> faithful <WG4103> in that which is another <WG245> man's, <WG245> who <WG5101> shall give <WG1325> you that which is your <WG5212> own?

No <WG3762> servant <WG3610> can <WG1410> serve <WG1398> two <WG1417> masters: <WG2962> for either <WG2228> he will hate <WG3404> the one, <WG1520> and love <WG25> the other; <WG2087> or <WG2228> else he will hold <WG472> to the one, <WG1520> and despise <WG2706> the other. <WG2087> You cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> serve <WG1398> God <WG2316> and mammon. <WG3126>
And the Pharisees <WG5330> also, <WG2532> who were covetous, <WG5366> heard <WG191> all <WG3956> these <WG5023> things: and they derided <WG1592> him.

And he said <WG2036> to them, You are they which <WG3588> justify <WG1344> yourselves <WG1438> before <WG1799> men; <WG444> but God <WG2316> knows <WG1097> your <WG5216> hearts: <WG2588> for that which is highly <WG5308> esteemed among <WG1722> men <WG444> is abomination <WG946> in the sight <WG1799> of God. <WG2316>

The law <WG3551> and the prophets <WG4396> were until <WG2193> John: <WG2491> since <WG575> that time <WG5119> the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is preached, <WG2097> and every <WG3956> man presses <WG971> into <WG1519> it.
And it is easier <WG2123> for heaven <WG3772> and earth <WG1093> to pass, <WG3928> than <WG2228> one <WG3391> pronunciation mark <WG2762> of the law <WG3551> to fail. <WG4098>

Whoever <WG3956> <WG3588> puts <WG630> away <WG630> his wife, <WG1135> and marries <WG1060> another, <WG2087> commits <WG3431> adultery: <WG3431> and whoever <WG3956> <WG3588> marries <WG1060> her that is put <WG630> away <WG630> from her husband <WG435> commits <WG3431> adultery. <WG3431>

There was a certain <WG5100> rich <WG4145> man, <WG444> which <WG2532> was clothed <WG1737> in purple <WG4209> and fine linen, <WG1040> and fared <WG2165> sumptuously <WG2988> every <WG2596> day: <WG2250>
And there was a certain <WG5100> beggar <WG4434> named <WG3686> Lazarus, <WG2976> which <WG3739> was laid <WG906> at <WG4314> his gate, <WG4440> full of sores, <WG1669>

And desiring <WG1937> to be fed <WG5526> with the crumbs <WG5589> which <WG3588> fell <WG4098> from the rich <WG4145> man's table: <WG5132> moreover <WG235> <WG2532> the dogs <WG2965> came <WG2064> and licked <WG621> his sores. <WG1668>

And it came <WG1096> to pass, that the beggar <WG4434> died, <WG599> and was carried <WG667> by the angels <WG32> into <WG1519> Abraham's <WG11> bosom: <WG2859> the rich <WG4145> man also <WG2532> died, <WG599> and was buried; <WG2290>
And in hell <WG86> he lift <WG1869> up his eyes, <WG3788> being <WG5225> in torments, <WG931> and sees <WG3708> Abraham <WG11> afar <WG3113> off, <WG575> and Lazarus <WG2976> in his bosom. <WG2859>

And he cried <WG5455> and said, <WG2036> Father <WG3962> Abraham, <WG11> have mercy <WG1653> on me, and send <WG3992> Lazarus, <WG2976> that he may dip <WG911> the tip <WG206> of his finger <WG1147> in water, <WG5204> and cool <WG2711> my tongue; <WG1100> for I am tormented <WG3600> in this <WG5026> flame. <WG5395>

But Abraham <WG11> said, <WG2036> Son, <WG5043> remember <WG3415> that you in your lifetime <WG2222> received <WG618> your good <WG18> things, and likewise <WG3668> Lazarus <WG2976> evil <WG2556> things: but now <WG3568> he is comforted, <WG3870> and you are tormented. <WG3600>

And beside <WG1909> all <WG3956> this, <WG5125> between <WG3342> us and you there is a great <WG3173> gulf <WG5490> fixed: <WG4741> so <WG3704> that they which would <WG2309> pass <WG1224> from hence <WG1782> to you cannot; <WG3361> <WG1410> neither <WG3366> can <WG1410> they pass <WG1276> to us, that would come from there. <WG1564>
Then <WG1161> he said, <WG2036> I pray <WG2065> you therefore, <WG3767> father, <WG3962> that you would send <WG3992> him to my father's <WG3962> house: <WG3624>

For I have <WG2192> five <WG4002> brothers; <WG80> that he may testify <WG1263> to them, lest <WG2443> <WG3361> they also <WG2532> come <WG2064> into <WG1519> this <WG5126> place <WG5117> of torment. <WG931>
Abraham <WG11> said <WG3004> to him, They have <WG2192> Moses <WG3475> and the prophets; <WG4396> let them hear <WG191> them.
And he said, <WG2036> No, <WG3780> father <WG3962> Abraham: <WG11> but if <WG1437> one <WG5100> went <WG4198> to them from the dead, <WG3498> they will repent. <WG3340>

And he said <WG2036> to him, If <WG1487> they hear <WG191> not Moses <WG3475> and the prophets, <WG4396> neither <WG3761> will they be persuaded, <WG3982> though <WG1437> one <WG5100> rose <WG450> from the dead. <WG3498>
